t: Philippians 2
If*p there be therefore any consolation in Christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any bowels and mercies,
Fulfil*p ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, having the same love, being of one accord, of one mind.
Let*p nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.
Look*p not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.
Let*p this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:
Who,*p being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:
But*p made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:
And*p being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.
Wherefore*p God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:
That*p at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of things in heaven, and things in earth, and things under the earth;
And*p that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
Wherefore,*p my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
For*p it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
Do*p all things without murmurings and disputings:
That*p ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world;
Holding*p forth the word of life; that I may rejoice in the day of Christ, that I have not run in vain, neither laboured in vain.
Yea,*p and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.
For*p the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.
But*p I trust in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy shortly unto you, that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.
For*p I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.
For*p all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ's.
But*p ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.
Him*p therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.
But*p I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.
Yet*p I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.
For*p he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.
For*p indeed he was sick nigh unto death: but God had mercy on him; and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
I*p sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.
Receive*p him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:
Because*p for the work of Christ he was nigh unto death, not regarding his life, to supply your lack of service toward me.
